basic_info.description: My name is Rob Ball and I am a software developer with a primary focus in Javascript and front-end development. Prior to beginning my career transition into tech, I served for 9 years as an Infantry Officer in the Army where I continuously led teams to accomplish ambitious goals. My interest in software development was sparked by my passion for building efficiencies and problem solving. I found that coding was a great way to combine those two passions while creating functional applications. In addition to software development, I am also expanding my skill set into Cyber Operations. I am a lifelong learner and am always looking forward to new technologies on the horizon.

projects.title: Git Push
projects.description: This was the final project for Code Fellows Code 201. This app is a clone of the popular game 'Flappy Bird' but with a git push theme. You must navigate your git push icon through the maze of merge conflicts. This app is built with JavaScript, HTML and CSS while utilizing JSON files and local storage for score keeping.

projects.title: Salmon Cookies
projects.description: Code Fellows 201 project that introduced rendering DOM elements using JavaScript. Users are able to enter a new 'franchise' location and pass in data. This data is then rendered onto the app and new total values are calculated

projects.title: Horned Beast Gallery
projects.description: This is a React powered image gallery that gives the user the ability to sort animals by the number of horns that they have.
